body.directions: Listen to the audio; then, complete the multiple-choice questions that follow.

body.quiz: Which of the following classes would you most likely need the item indicated in the audio?
body.answer: Audio for 中文课 zhōngwénkè
options: Audio for 数学课 shùxuékè
Audio for 体育课 tǐyùkè
Audio for 艺术课 yìshùkè
body.correct: Very nicely done! 字典 zìdiǎn means “dictionary,” and you most likely need it for language classes such as 中文课 zhōngwénkè (Chinese class).
body.incorrect: So close! Listen to the word again to identify its meaning. Then consider how you may use it for one of the classes in the choices.

body.quiz: Which of the following places would you least likely find the item indicated in the audio?
body.correct: Very nicely done! 剪刀 jiǎndāo means “scissors,” and the place in the choices that you need it the least would be in your PE class.
body.incorrect: Not quite…listen to the word again to understand its meaning, and then consider in which of the four choices you would least expect it.

body.quiz: Which of the following words belongs in the same category as the word in audio?
body.correct: Wonderfully done! 马克笔 mǎkèbǐ means “marker,” and it’s a borrowed word. Another borrowed word among the choices is 苏打 sūdǎ (soda), which is also a direct translation by sound from English.
body.incorrect: Not quite…listen to the word again and think about its meaning in English. Then compare their pronunciations in both Chinese and English and check the choices to see which word has similar feature.

body.quiz: Which of the following sentences can be best completed with the word in the audio?
body.answer: 上数学课我需要_____。 Shàng shùxuékè wǒ xūyào _____.
options: 今天我_____到达学校 Jīntiān wǒ _____ dàodá xuéxiào.
我的生日是六月_____ Wǒde shēngrì shì liùyuè _____.
请给我三碗_____。 Qǐng gěi wǒ sān wǎn_____.
body.correct: Fantastic job! 尺子 chǐzi means “ruler,” and it can best fit in the sentence 上数学课我需要尺子 Shàng shùxuékè wǒ xūyào chǐzi. (For math class, I need a ruler.)
body.incorrect: Oops… listen to the audio one more time to identify the meaning of the word, and then place it in the blanks of the choices to see which one fits the best for both grammar and meaning.
